gov.usgs.locator

Class LocUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.locator.LocUtil

  • public class LocUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Locator static constants and utilities.
    Author:
    Ray Buland

      Association tolerance in seconds.

      Receiver azimuth relative to the source in degrees clockwise from north (available after calling delAz).

      Convergence criteria in kilometers for each stage.

      Conversion from degrees to kilometers (assumes the radius of the Earth model is 6371 kilometers).

      The maximum distance from the epicenter in degrees considered local for the purposes of GT5.
      static double DELTATOL
      Maximum the epicenter can move and still be considered to be the same as the starting epicenter.
      static double DEPTHMAX
      Maximum depth the Locator will allow.
      static double DEPTHMIN
      Minimum depth the Locator will allow.
      static double DEPTHTOL
      Maximum the depth can move and still be considered to be the same as the starting depth.
      static double DOWNWEIGHT
      Factor to down weight undesirable phase identifications.
      static double EFFOFFSET
      Offset for compensating for the effective number of data if decorrelation is not used.
      static double EFFSLOPE
      Slope for compensating for the effective number of data if decorrelation is not used.
      static double EVLIM
      When decorrelating, keep the largest eigenvalues adding up to at least 95%.
      static double EVTHRESH
      When decorrelating, don't eliminate eigenvalues larger than 1% the size of the largest eigenvalue.
      static double GROUPWEIGHT
      Factor to down weight phases that don't match, but are in the same group.
      static double HELDEPSE
      Default Bayesian depth standard error in kilometers for a held depth solution.
      static double[] HQUALIM
      Tangential (horizontal) limits on aveH for quality levels.
      static double INITSTEP
      Start each iteration loop with this step length.
      static int[] ITERLIM
      Maximum number of iterations for each stage.
      static double MADNORM
      Normalization to make the median absolute deviation (MAD, also referred to as the spread in the Locator) match the standard deviation for a Gaussian distribution.
      static int MAXCORR
      The maximum number of picks to decorrelate.
      static boolean NOBACKBRN
      If true, suppress back branches.
      static int[] NQUALIM
      Limits on the number of phases used for quality levels.
      static double NULLAFFINITY
      Default trial affinity when the phases don't match.
      static double OBSERVMIN
      Minimum acceptable observability for an alternative phase identification.
      static double PERPT1D
      Scale raw marginal confidence intervals to 90th percentiles.
      static double PERPT2D
      Scale 2-D (i.e., epicenter) confidence intervals to 90th percentiles.
      static double PERPT3D
      Scale 3-D (i.e., hypocenter) confidence intervals to 90th percentiles.
      static java.lang.String[] PHLIST
      The Locator always uses all phases (i.e., a null phase list).
      static boolean rstt
      If true use the RSTT 2.5D model for local phases.
      static boolean server
      False for stand alone testing, true to integrate into the location server.
      static int STAGELIM
      Maximum number of iteration stages to attempt.
      static double[] STEPLIM
      Maximum step length in kilometers to allow for each stage.
      static double STEPTOL
      Step tolerance dividing "did not converge" from "unstable solution".
      static boolean tectonic
      If false the event is in a craton with a well defined Conrad discontinuity and distinct Pb and Sb phases.
      static double TYPEWEIGHT
      Factor to down weight phases that don't even match in type.
      static boolean USEFUL
      If true suppress phases that are unlikely to be observed.
      static double[] VQUALIM
      Vertical (radial) limits on seDepth for quality levels.

      • DEFDEPSE

        public static final double DEFDEPSE
        Default Bayesian depth standard error in kilometers for a free depth solution. This assumes that if we don't have a good estimate for the Bayesian depth, the event is probably in the crust (i.e., 15 +/- 15 km).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HELDEPSE

        public static final double HELDEPSE
        Default Bayesian depth standard error in kilometers for a held depth solution.

      • MAXCORR

        public static final int MAXCORR
        The maximum number of picks to decorrelate. Note that the magic number in the Fortran version was 450, but that included the Bayesian depth, which is excluded here.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EVLIM

        public static final double EVLIM
        When decorrelating, keep the largest eigenvalues adding up to at least 95%.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EVTHRESH

        public static final double EVTHRESH
        When decorrelating, don't eliminate eigenvalues larger than 1% the size of the largest eigenvalue.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PHLIST

        public static final java.lang.String[] PHLIST
        The Locator always uses all phases (i.e., a null phase list).

      • USEFUL

        public static final boolean USEFUL
        If true suppress phases that are unlikely to be observed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NOBACKBRN

        public static final boolean NOBACKBRN
        If true, suppress back branches.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • deCorrelate

        public static boolean deCorrelate
        True if the decorrelation algorithm is to be used. Note that it is never used in the initial pass, hence the default.

      • rstt

        public static boolean rstt
        If true use the RSTT 2.5D model for local phases. Note that it is never used in the initial pass, hence the default.

      • tectonic

        public static boolean tectonic
        If false the event is in a craton with a well defined Conrad discontinuity and distinct Pb and Sb phases. If true, the event is in a tectonic area where Pb and Sb are extensions of Pg and Sg respectively.

      • deBugLevel

        public static int deBugLevel
        The higher the debug level, the more output you get.

      • server

        public static boolean server
        False for stand alone testing, true to integrate into the location server.

      • azimuth

        public static double azimuth
        Receiver azimuth relative to the source in degrees clockwise from north (available after calling delAz).

      • delAz

        public static double delAz(Hypocenter hypo,
                           Station sta)
        Compute the source-receiver distance and the receiver azimuth. An historically significant subroutine from deep time (1962)! This routine was written by Bob Engdahl in Fortran (actually in the days before subroutines) and beaten into it's current Fortran form by Ray Buland in the early 1980s. It's optimized with respect to computing sines and cosines (probably still worthwhile) and it computes exactly what's needed--no more, no less. Note that the azimuth is returned in static variable azimuth.
        Parameters:
        hypo - Hypocenter object
        sta - Station object
        Returns:
        Distance (delta) in degrees

      • delStep

        public static double delStep(Hypocenter hypo,
                             HypoAudit audit)
        Compute the epicentral distance between two hypocenters.
        Parameters:
        hypo - Hypocenter information
        audit - Hypocenter audit information
        Returns:
        Distance between hypocenters in kilometers

      • hypoCompare

        public static boolean hypoCompare(Hypocenter hypo,
                                  HypoAudit audit)
        Compare two hypocenters.
        Parameters:
        hypo - Hypocenter information
        audit - Hypocenter audit information
        Returns:
        True if the hypocenters are (nearly) the same

      • covariance

        public static double covariance(Pick pick1,
                                Pick pick2)
        Compute the empirical covariance between two picks. The covariance form was developed by Bondar and McLauglin (BSSA, vol. 99, pp 172-193). The constants were fit by Buland based on first arriving data from four years of Chicxulub data.
        Parameters:
        pick1 - Information for the first pick
        pick2 - Information for the second pick
        Returns:
        Covariance between pick1 and pick2

      • dTdLat

        public static double dTdLat(double dTdD,
                            double azimuth)
        Calculate the derivative of travel time with respect to latitude.
        Parameters:
        dTdD - Derivative of travel time with respect to distance in seconds/degree
        azimuth - Azimuth of the receiver from the source in degrees
        Returns:
        Derivative of travel time with respect to latitude in seconds/kilometer

      • dTdLon

        public static double dTdLon(double dTdD,
                            double azimuth)
        Calculate the derivative of travel time with respect to longitude.
        Parameters:
        dTdD - Derivative of travel time with respect to distance in seconds/degree
        azimuth - Azimuth of the receiver from the source in degrees
        Returns:
        Derivative of travel time with respect to longitude in seconds/kilometer

      • ttResModel

        public static double ttResModel(double residual,
                                double median,
                                double spread)
        The canonical Buland statistical model for travel-time residuals is a linear combination of a Gaussian and a Cauchy distribution. In practice, the canonical model must be adapted for the median and spread of the phase of interest. This method then calculates the value of the phase probability density function at the desired residual.
        Parameters:
        residual - Travel-time residual in seconds
        median - Median probability density function time in seconds relative to the theoretical travel time (usually zero)
        spread - Probability density function spread in seconds for the desired phase
        Returns:
        Probability density function value for the desired residual

      • deltaCorr

        public static double deltaCorr(double delta)
        Compute a crude correction to the figure-of-merit to make phase identifications at near distances more likely. This is principally a problem for the closest station to a subduction event due to the complex structure. It should only be applied to the first arrival in any pick group.
        Parameters:
        delta - Distance in degrees
        Returns:
        Correction to the phase association figure-of-merit

      • validLim

        public static double validLim(double spread)
        To be a valid association, the travel-time residual must be smaller than the validity limit determined from the spread. This is, of course, a purely empirical limit based on years of Hydra experience.
        Parameters:
        spread - Statistical spread in seconds
        Returns:
        Empirical validity limit

      • dampFactor

        public static double dampFactor()
        Sometimes you can jiggle a machine to jog it out of a rut. In this case the damping factor is jiggled to avoid loops when step length damping is required. Note that, the step length will be damped by multiplying it by the damping factor.
        Returns:
        Updated damping factor

      • isGT5

        public static boolean isGT5(int locPhUsed,
                            double delMin,
                            double azimGap,
                            double lestGap)
        Test whether this event meets the criteria for the old "ground truth within 5 kilometers" (GT5) algorithm.
        Parameters:
        locPhUsed - Number of local phases used
        delMin - Distance to the closest station used in degrees
        azimGap - Azimuthal gap in degrees
        lestGap - Robust azimuthal gap in degrees
        Returns:
        True if this event qualifies as GT5

        public static double[] unitVector(double[] vector)

        Parameters:
        vector - Vector
        Returns:
        Unit vector

      • getRayTime

        public static java.lang.String getRayTime(double time)
        Produce a time string from a Hydra time suitable for printing. Hydra uses doubles instead of longs, but (conveniently) the same epoch. The string returned is valid to milliseconds and uses 24-hour times.
        Parameters:
        time - Hydra date-time stamp
        Returns:
        Time string

      • getRayDate

        public static java.lang.String getRayDate(double time)
        Produce a date-time string from a Hydra time suitable for printing. Hydra uses doubles instead of longs, but (conveniently) the same epoch. The string returned is valid to milliseconds and uses 24-hour times.
        Parameters:
        time - Hydra date-time stamp
        Returns:
        Date-time string
